APPOINTMENT: The act of appointing a person to hold an office or to have a position of trust
DATE: The fruit of the ____ palm, Phoenix dactylifera, somewhat in the shape of an olive, containing a soft, sweet pulp and enclosing a hard kernel.
HOLIDAY: A day on which a festival, religious event, or national celebration is traditionally observed.
MONTH: A period into which a year is divided, historically based on the phases of the moon.
WEEK: Any period of seven consecutive days.
YEAR: A solar ____, the time it takes the Earth to complete one revolution of the Sun (between 365.24 and 365.26 days depending on the point of reference).
